titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Woman’s Institute of Domestic Arts and Sciences graded embroidery examination with stitch samples, 1919 RL.11200
titlestmt.author: Alice Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Woman’s Institute of Domestic Arts and Sciences graded embroidery examination with stitch samples

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Woman’s Institute of Domestic Arts and Sciences

did.abstract: Collection comprises a four-page embroidery examination completed in ink by Mrs. Fred Kennedy in Norfolk, Nebraska, including 6 stitch samples. The exam did not provide the questions, and has been annotated by the person who graded it, who also attached four typed comments to the stitch samples. Includes original mailing envelope.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Woman’s Institute of Domestic Arts and Sciences in Scranton, Pennsylvania, was founded in 1916 by Mary Brooks Picken. The school combined correspondence courses with classroom instruction in dressmaking, millinery, cooking, fashion design, beauty, and homemaking. It attracted students from around the world and enrollment climbed to almost 300,000 women. It reached thousands more through its newsletters and other publications.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Woman’s Institute of Domestic Arts and Sciences graded embroidery examination with stitch samples was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Woman’s Institute of Domestic Arts and Sciences graded embroidery examination with stitch samples, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2016-0075

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a four-page embroidery examination completed in ink by Mrs. Fred Kennedy in Norfolk, Nebraska, including 6 stitch samples. The exam did not provide the questions, and has been annotated by the person who graded it, who also attached four typed comments to the stitch samples. Includes original mailing envelope.
